segments.en: Hello, English learners.
segments.cn: 你好，英语学习者。

segments.en: Welcome back to another advanced lesson here at EnglishPod.
segments.cn: 欢迎回到EnglishPod的另一个高级课程。

segments.en: My name is Marco.
segments.cn: 我叫Marco。

segments.en: And I'm Erica.
segments.cn: 我是Erica。

segments.en: And today we're going to be back in the office.
segments.cn: 今天我们将回到办公室。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: We are listening in as somebody gets a little bit of trouble from their boss for being a bit late on a project.
segments.cn: 我们正在听某人因项目延迟而受到老板的责备。

segments.en: Alright, so we're going to be at the office.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们将在办公室。

segments.en: Somebody misses a deadline.
segments.cn: 有人错过了截止日期。

segments.en: And so, well, how do you handle the situation?
segments.cn: 那么，你如何处理这种情况？

segments.en: What can you do to explain yourself?
segments.cn: 你能做些什么来解释自己？

segments.en: And what language can you actually use to talk about missed deadlines and late work?
segments.cn: 你可以用什么语言来谈论错过的截止日期和延迟的工作？

segments.en: Alright, so let's see why this person missed the deadline and let's find out what happens.
segments.cn: 好吧，让我们看看这个人为什么错过了截止日期，看看会发生什么。

segments.en: And so I just wanted to check in with you and find out where we are with this project.
segments.cn: 我只是想和你确认一下这个项目的进展。

segments.en: As you know, you missed a fairly significant deadline last week and this will negatively impact the team's ability to move forward with the next stages of this project.
segments.cn: 如你所知，你上周错过了一个相当重要的截止日期，这将对团队推进项目的下一阶段产生负面影响。

segments.en: I know.
segments.cn: 我知道。

segments.en: I'm really sorry that I missed a deadline.
segments.cn: 我真的很抱歉错过了截止日期。

segments.en: But really, it wasn't my fault.
segments.cn: 但真的，这不是我的错。

segments.en: You see, we had all of these unexpected technical problems at the last minute.
segments.cn: 你看，我们在最后一刻遇到了所有这些意外的技术问题。

segments.en: And I couldn't get into the database and extract the kind of information that I needed for the data analysis.
segments.cn: 我无法进入数据库提取我需要的数据分析信息。

segments.en: You know, if the tech guys would have done their job and kept the CRM stable, then I wouldn't have missed my deadline.
segments.cn: 你知道，如果技术人员能做好他们的工作并保持CRM稳定，我就不会错过截止日期。

segments.en: Oh, come on.
segments.cn: 哦，得了吧。

segments.en: An excuse like that is tantamount to lying.
segments.cn: 这样的借口等同于撒谎。

segments.en: You're essentially blaming the tech team for your time management issues rather than accepting responsibility for the fact that you were procrastinating for the past two weeks.
segments.cn: 你实际上是在把时间管理问题归咎于技术团队，而不是接受你在过去两周拖延的事实。

segments.en: No, I'm not trying to pass the buck here.
segments.cn: 不，我不是在推卸责任。

segments.en: I know it was me who was ultimately responsible for getting this done.
segments.cn: 我知道最终负责完成这项工作的是我。

segments.en: But the thing is, I could have finished on time if the system hadn't gone down.
segments.cn: 但问题是，如果系统没有崩溃，我本可以按时完成。

segments.en: And you know, with everything I've got going on now, I can't afford to waste time dealing with technical problems.
segments.cn: 你知道，考虑到我现在的所有事情，我不能浪费时间处理技术问题。

segments.en: I've got a lot on my plate and there are only 24 hours in a day.
segments.cn: 我有很多事情要做，一天只有24小时。

segments.en: I'm not going to accept this excuse.
segments.cn: 我不会接受这个借口。

segments.en: You're using these small technical glitches as a crutch and trying to rationalize the fact that you've missed your deadline.
segments.cn: 你把这些小技术故障当作拐杖，试图合理化你错过截止日期的事实。

segments.en: Look, we have standards and I expect you to live up to those standards.
segments.cn: 听着，我们有标准，我希望你能达到这些标准。

segments.en: No more phony excuses.
segments.cn: 不要再有虚假的借口。

segments.en: If you're in over your head, you tell me no more missed deadlines.
segments.cn: 如果你力不从心，你就告诉我，不要再错过截止日期。

segments.en: Now I want that data on my desk by 9am.
segments.cn: 现在我希望早上9点之前把数据放在我的桌子上。

segments.en: Well, it sounds like this guy isn't really accepting a lot of the responsibility for his missed deadline.
segments.cn: 好吧，看来这个家伙并没有真正承担错过截止日期的责任。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正是如此。

segments.en: Well, apparently he's explaining that it wasn't only his fault, right?
segments.cn: 显然，他在解释这并不完全是他的错，对吧？

segments.en: Yep.
segments.cn: 是的。

segments.en: So some technical problems, but you know, he used a lot of pretty, pretty interesting language.
segments.cn: 所以有一些技术问题，但你知道，他使用了很多非常有趣的语言。

segments.en: And I think it'll help us to look at that now in language takeaway.
segments.cn: 我认为现在看看这些语言会对我们有帮助。

segments.en: Language takeaway.
segments.cn: 语言要点。

segments.en: Alright, so in language takeaway today we have five words and let's start with the first one.
segments.cn: 好吧，今天的语言要点我们有五个单词，让我们从第一个开始。

segments.en: Alright, well, the boss is not really happy with the excuse that the employee was giving and he said an excuse like that is tantamount to lying.
segments.cn: 好吧，老板对员工的借口并不满意，他说这样的借口等同于撒谎。

segments.en: Tantamount?
segments.cn: 等同于？

segments.en: Tantamount to something.
segments.cn: 等同于某事。

segments.en: Ok, so if an excuse like that is tantamount to lying, what is what is he trying to say here?
segments.cn: 好吧，如果这样的借口等同于撒谎，他想说什么？

segments.en: Basically, it's the same as or it's almost the same as.
segments.cn: 基本上，它是相同的或几乎相同的。

segments.en: So similar to.
segments.cn: 所以类似于。

segments.en: So if I say tantamount to something else, how would I use it?
segments.cn: 如果我说等同于其他事情，我该如何使用它？

segments.en: You know, Marco, taking my computer without asking is tantamount to stealing.
segments.cn: 你知道，Marco，未经允许拿走我的电脑等同于偷窃。

segments.en: Okay, so even though I'm not actually stealing it or taking it home with me, yeah, it is almost like stealing.
segments.cn: 好吧，尽管我并没有真正偷走它或把它带回家，但确实几乎像偷窃。

segments.en: Yeah.
segments.cn: 是的。

segments.en: And the interesting grammatical thing here is that we almost always use a gerund right after so tantamount to verb ing. Ok, tantamount to stealing, tantamount to lying, tantamount to killing.
segments.cn: 有趣的语法是，我们几乎总是在后面使用动名词，所以等同于动词ing。 好吧，等同于偷窃，等同于撒谎，等同于杀人。

segments.en: Ok, well on that happy note, let's go on to our next word.
segments.cn: 好吧，在这个愉快的音符上，让我们继续下一个单词。

segments.en: Now the boss was really unhappy with the employee for procrastinating.
segments.cn: 现在老板对员工拖延感到非常不满。

segments.en: Procrastinating.
segments.cn: 拖延。

segments.en: Procrastinating.
segments.cn: 拖延。

segments.en: So the verb is to procrastinate.
segments.cn: 所以动词是拖延。

segments.en: And when you procrastinate, you say, oh, I'll do it later, I'll do it tomorrow.
segments.cn: 当你拖延时，你会说，哦，我稍后再做，我明天再做。

segments.en: Okay, so you kind of delay things or you leave it for another day.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以你有点推迟事情，或者把它留到另一天。

segments.en: Yep.
segments.cn: 是的。

segments.en: Alright, very good.
segments.cn: 好吧，非常好。

segments.en: So to procrastinate.
segments.cn: 所以拖延。

segments.en: A favorite verb amongst college students.
segments.cn: 大学生最喜欢的动词。

segments.en: I actually thought for a little while that procrastinate was to have babies.
segments.cn: 我实际上曾经认为拖延是生孩子。

segments.en: Oh, ok.
segments.cn: 哦，好的。

segments.en: It's kind of similar.
segments.cn: 这有点相似。

segments.en: What's the word?
segments.cn: 那个词是什么？

segments.en: Procreate.
segments.cn: 繁殖。

segments.en: Procreate.
segments.cn: 繁殖。

segments.en: Yeah.
segments.cn: 是的。

segments.en: So for a while I always thought that procrastinate was like having babies.
segments.cn: 所以一段时间我总是认为拖延就像生孩子。

segments.en: Like, why are you procrastinating?
segments.cn: 像，为什么你在拖延？

segments.en: And I'm like, I'm not.
segments.cn: 我说，我没有。

segments.en: Well, glad you got that straight.
segments.cn: 好吧，真高兴你搞清楚了。

segments.en: So yes, our listeners, procrastinate is not the same as procreate.
segments.cn: 所以是的，我们的听众，拖延和繁殖不是同一回事。

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好吧。

segments.en: I learned that the hard way.
segments.cn: 我是通过艰难的方式学到这一点的。

segments.en: Yes, um, well it sounds like you had a little bit of a glitch in your understanding of language and that's our next phrase.
segments.cn: 是的，嗯，听起来你在理解语言方面有一点小故障，这就是我们的下一个短语。

segments.en: So in the dialogue, they were talking about some glitches with the system.
segments.cn: 在对话中，他们谈到了系统的一些故障。

segments.en: A glitch in the system.
segments.cn: 系统故障。

segments.en: Okay, so a glitch.
segments.cn: 好吧，故障。

segments.en: Now this is common among computers, right?
segments.cn: 这在计算机中很常见，对吧？

segments.en: A glitch is an error.
segments.cn: 故障是一个错误。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: So when you're talking about a glitch and you're talking about computers, it's an error, a mistake.
segments.cn: 所以当你谈论故障时，谈论计算机时，它是一个错误，一个失误。

segments.en: But we also use it to talk about any unexpected problem.
segments.cn: 但我们也用它来谈论任何意外的问题。

segments.en: A small unexpected problem.
segments.cn: 一个小的意外问题。

segments.en: Okay, so a small glitch.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以一个小故障。

segments.en: Yeah.
segments.cn: 是的。

segments.en: There was a glitch in our plan and we arrived 10 minutes late.
segments.cn: 我们的计划中出现了故障，我们迟到了10分钟。

segments.en: Or I can say this movie has a glitch in the story.
segments.cn: 或者我可以说这部电影的故事有一个故障。

segments.en: So there's a small problem in the story that doesn't make sense.
segments.cn: 所以故事中有一个小问题，不合逻辑。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正是如此。

segments.en: All right.
segments.cn: 好吧。

segments.en: So the employee was blaming his lateness on these small technical glitches, but the boss didn't believe this, right?
segments.cn: 所以员工把他的迟到归咎于这些小技术故障，但老板不相信，对吧？

segments.en: The boss said you're trying to rationalize the fact that you missed the deadline.
segments.cn: 老板说你在试图合理化你错过截止日期的事实。

segments.en: Okay, to rationalize.
segments.cn: 好吧，合理化。

segments.en: To rationalize.
segments.cn: 合理化。

segments.en: So the boss is saying that he's trying to rationalize.
segments.cn: 所以老板是在说他在试图找借口。

segments.en: So that means is he trying to make sense of it?
segments.cn: 那这意味着他是在试图理解这一切吗？

segments.en: Well, this is an interesting psychological word.
segments.cn: 嗯，这是一个有趣的心理学词汇。

segments.en: And when you rationalize something, you think about it or describe it, like especially some bad behavior in a way that makes it seem better or proper or more sensible.
segments.cn: 当你为某事找借口时，你会以某种方式思考或描述它，尤其是一些不良行为，使其看起来更好或更合理。

segments.en: So you're trying to convince yourself?
segments.cn: 所以你是在试图说服自己？

segments.en: Yeah, you're telling other people, but you're also telling yourself that it's better.
segments.cn: 是的，你在告诉别人，但你也在告诉自己这更好。

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: Or that you're right when you're actually wrong?
segments.cn: 或者你认为自己是对的，而实际上是错的？

segments.en: Yes.
segments.cn: 是的。

segments.en: Yeah.
segments.cn: 是的。

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: So he was trying to rationalize the fact that he missed the deadline.
segments.cn: 所以他在试图为错过截止日期找借口。

segments.en: So he was trying to explain to the boss and also kind of make himself believe that it wasn't really his fault when it was.
segments.cn: 所以他在试图向老板解释，并让自己相信这并不是他的错，尽管实际上是。

segments.en: Now, because this is a little bit of a difficult concept to understand, I think we should hear some examples.
segments.cn: 现在，因为这是一个有点难以理解的概念，我认为我们应该听一些例子。

segments.en: Example one.
segments.cn: 例子一。

segments.en: You can't rationalize your son's behavior by saying he's going through a hard time.
segments.cn: 你不能通过说你儿子正在经历困难时期来为他的行为找借口。

segments.en: Example two.
segments.cn: 例子二。

segments.en: As much as I tried, I couldn't rationalize buying such an expensive pair of shoes.
segments.cn: 尽管我努力尝试，我还是无法为买这么贵的一双鞋找借口。

segments.en: Example three.
segments.cn: 例子三。

segments.en: You know, it was the wrong thing to do.
segments.cn: 你知道，这样做是错误的。

segments.en: Stop trying to rationalize it.
segments.cn: 别再试图为此找借口了。

segments.en: Okay, so clear as daylight now this word rationalize.
segments.cn: 好的，现在这个词“找借口”很清楚了。

segments.en: Alright, in our final words, so the boss really wasn't happy with these excuses.
segments.cn: 好吧，在我们最后的话中，老板对这些借口真的不满意。

segments.en: And he said, no more phony excuses.
segments.cn: 他还说，不要再有虚假的借口了。

segments.en: Okay, phony phony p h o n y phony.
segments.cn: 好的，虚假，虚假，p h o n y，虚假。

segments.en: So phony is basically false or fake.
segments.cn: 所以虚假基本上是假的或伪造的。

segments.en: Right?
segments.cn: 对吧？

segments.en: So a phony statement.
segments.cn: 所以一个虚假的声明。

segments.en: A phony watch.
segments.cn: 一块虚假的手表。

segments.en: Okay, a fake watch.
segments.cn: 好的，一块假手表。

segments.en: Yeah, not a Sony watch, but a phony.
segments.cn: 是的，不是索尼手表，而是虚假的。

segments.en: So a lot of great words in this dialogue.
segments.cn: 所以这个对话中有很多很棒的词汇。

segments.en: But as you mentioned, we also saw some very interesting phrases that we can use in situations like this.
segments.cn: 但正如你提到的，我们也看到了一些非常有趣的短语，可以在这样的情况下使用。

segments.en: So why don't we start now with fluency builder.
segments.cn: 所以我们现在为什么不开始流利度提升呢？

segments.en: Fluency builder.
segments.cn: 流利度提升。

segments.en: Well, you know, one of the interesting things about English is that we have a lot of ways to make things sound more direct, less direct, harder or softer.
segments.cn: 嗯，你知道，英语中有很多方式让事情听起来更直接、更间接、更强烈或更温和。

segments.en: And in this dialogue, there are a few examples of how we use softening words to but just to do the opposite to actually make it a little strong.
segments.cn: 在这个对话中，有几个例子展示了我们如何使用缓和词，但实际上是为了让它更强烈。

segments.en: Okay, so why don't we start with the first paragraph.
segments.cn: 好的，那我们为什么不从第一段开始呢？

segments.en: In the first part of the dialogue, he said you missed a fairly significant deadline, a fairly significant deadline.
segments.cn: 在对话的第一部分，他说你错过了一个相当重要的截止日期，一个相当重要的截止日期。

segments.en: Now this word fairly, kind of sort of so it's not very significant.
segments.cn: 现在这个词“相当”，有点像，所以它并不是非常重要。

segments.en: It's kind of significant.
segments.cn: 它有点重要。

segments.en: Yeah.
segments.cn: 是的。

segments.en: But in this context, when when the person is saying it, it just sounds a little bit softer.
segments.cn: 但在这个上下文中，当这个人说时，它听起来有点温和。

segments.en: But your understanding is it's a very important deadline.
segments.cn: 但你的理解是这是一个非常重要的截止日期。

segments.en: Okay, a very important deadline.
segments.cn: 好的，一个非常重要的截止日期。

segments.en: So another similar example of this is the boss was saying you're essentially blaming the tech team.
segments.cn: 所以另一个类似的例子是老板在说你基本上是在责怪技术团队。

segments.en: Okay, you're essentially blaming.
segments.cn: 好的，你基本上是在责怪。

segments.en: So essentially is like basically or pretty much.
segments.cn: 所以“基本上”就像是“基本上”或“差不多”。

segments.en: So it sounds a little softer.
segments.cn: 听起来有点温和。

segments.en: But what he's actually really saying is, you're doing this right.
segments.cn: 但他实际上是在说，你是在责怪技术团队。

segments.en: So instead of saying, you're blaming the tech team, he adds this word essentially to kind of say, well, basically, you're saying it's their fault.
segments.cn: 所以他没有直接说你在责怪技术团队，而是加上这个词“基本上”，以便说，嗯，基本上，你是在说这是他们的错。

segments.en: Yeah.
segments.cn: 是的。

segments.en: But the context or you understand that it's actually very direct, and he's saying it's your fault.
segments.cn: 但上下文或你理解的是他实际上是非常直接的，他在说这是你的错。

segments.en: Yeah.
segments.cn: 是的。

segments.en: So he's, he's saying, you're almost blaming the tech team.
segments.cn: 所以他说，你几乎是在责怪技术团队。

segments.en: But what he means is you're blaming the tech team.
segments.cn: 但他的意思是你在责怪技术团队。

segments.en: Now, our third phrase is very interesting because it's kind of like a saying.
segments.cn: 现在，我们的第三个短语非常有趣，因为它有点像一个说法。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So the employee says, I'm not trying to pass the buck here.
segments.cn: 所以员工说，我不是在推卸责任。

segments.en: I'm not trying to pass the buck here.
segments.cn: 我不是在推卸责任。

segments.en: I'm not trying to pass the buck.
segments.cn: 我不是在推卸责任。

segments.en: Now, what's the buck?
segments.cn: 现在，什么是“责任”？

segments.en: A dollar bill, a dollar bill.
segments.cn: 一美元钞票，一美元钞票。

segments.en: So he's will understand that he's saying I'm not trying to blame somebody else or pass the blame onto someone else.
segments.cn: 所以他会理解他在说我不是在责怪别人或把责任推给别人。

segments.en: But you can think about it like this.
segments.cn: 但你可以这样想。

segments.en: Like, imagine he had some fake or phony money, right?
segments.cn: 比如，想象一下他有一些假钱，对吧？

segments.en: And he wants to pass that on to the next person so he doesn't get in trouble.
segments.cn: 他想把它传给下一个人，这样他就不会惹麻烦。

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: So I'm not trying to pass the buck.
segments.cn: 所以我不是在推卸责任。

segments.en: I'm not trying to pass the blame, put the responsibility on someone else.
segments.cn: 我不是在推卸责任，把责任推给别人。

segments.en: Very good.
segments.cn: 非常好。

segments.en: But you know what, you know what he really means here?
segments.cn: 但你知道他真正的意思是什么吗？

segments.en: What?
segments.cn: 什么？

segments.en: I am trying to do this.
segments.cn: 我是在这样做。

segments.en: Because he knew, yeah, he knew that it was a fake dollar bill.
segments.cn: 因为他知道，是的，他知道那是一张假钞。

segments.en: Yeah, yeah.
segments.cn: 是的，是的。

segments.en: Now, the fourth one is interesting as well, because it's kind of like a metaphor.
segments.cn: 现在，第四个也很有趣，因为它有点像一个隐喻。

segments.en: He said, the boss said, you're using the small technical glitches as a crutch.
segments.cn: 他说，老板说，你把小的技术故障当作拐杖。

segments.en: So using something as a crutch.
segments.cn: 所以把某物当作拐杖。

segments.en: Now, the crutch is a... You know when you break your leg, you use those wooden or metal sticks to walk with?
segments.cn: 现在，拐杖是……你知道，当你摔断腿时，你用那些木头或金属棍子走路，对吧？

segments.en: Okay, to help you walk.
segments.cn: 好的，帮助你走路。

segments.en: Yeah.
segments.cn: 是的。

segments.en: So the boss is basically saying you're using these technical glitches as an excuse or as an aid to why you missed the deadline.
segments.cn: 所以老板基本上是在说你把这些技术故障当作借口或帮助，来解释你为什么错过截止日期。

segments.en: Yeah.
segments.cn: 是的。

segments.en: So if you think about it like this, some people might say, okay, if you walk with a crutch, then you won't succeed, right?
segments.cn: 所以如果你这样想，有些人可能会说，好吧，如果你用拐杖走路，那么你就不会成功，对吧？

segments.en: Because, whatever.
segments.cn: 因为，无论如何。

segments.en: So this guy, this employee is basically saying, yes, I know that I should meet deadlines.
segments.cn: 所以这个家伙，这个员工基本上是在说，是的，我知道我应该遵守截止日期。

segments.en: But these these problems, these glitches are like my crutch that make me not succeed.
segments.cn: 但这些问题，这些故障就像是我的拐杖，让我无法成功。

segments.en: Okay, so he's trying to just make excuses.
segments.cn: 好的，所以他只是在找借口。

segments.en: So, um, God, Marco, that was a little bit difficult to understand.
segments.cn: 所以，嗯，天哪，马尔科，这有点难以理解。

segments.en: Do you think we should give a couple more examples?
segments.cn: 你认为我们应该再给几个例子吗？

segments.en: Yeah, I think I think some more examples would be very useful.
segments.cn: 是的，我认为再给几个例子会很有用。

segments.en: So let's listen to a couple of them now.
segments.cn: 所以我们现在来听几个例子。

segments.en: Example one.
segments.cn: 例子一。

segments.en: I realized that I was using alcohol as a crutch to get through the day.
segments.cn: 我意识到我在用酒精作为拐杖来度过这一天。

segments.en: Example two.
segments.cn: 例子二。

segments.en: I think Bill's very capable of being successful, but he uses his disability as a crutch.
segments.cn: 我认为比尔非常有能力成功，但他把自己的残疾当作支柱。

segments.en: Example three.
segments.cn: 例子三。

segments.en: Stop using your weight as a crutch.
segments.cn: 别把你的体重当作支柱。

segments.en: Just because you're a bit fat doesn't mean you can't get a great job.
segments.cn: 仅仅因为你有点胖并不意味着你不能找到一份好工作。

segments.en: Alright, so a lot of great phrases, great words.
segments.cn: 好吧，很多很棒的短语，很棒的词汇。

segments.en: And well, I think it's time for us to listen to this dialogue for the last time.
segments.cn: 我想是时候最后一次听这个对话了。

segments.en: And then we'll come back and talk about this aspect of meeting deadlines.
segments.cn: 然后我们再回来讨论一下关于按时完成任务的这个方面。

segments.en: And so I just wanted to check in with you and find out where we are with this project.
segments.cn: 我只是想和你确认一下，我们这个项目的进展如何。

segments.en: As you know, you missed a fairly significant deadline last week, and this will negatively impact the team's ability to move forward with the next stages of this project.
segments.cn: 你知道，上周你错过了一个相当重要的截止日期，这将对团队推进项目的下一阶段产生负面影响。

segments.en: I know, I'm really sorry that I missed the deadline.
segments.cn: 我知道，我真的很抱歉错过了截止日期。

segments.en: But really, it wasn't my fault.
segments.cn: 但真的，这不是我的错。

segments.en: You see, we had all of these unexpected technical problems at the last minute.
segments.cn: 你看，我们在最后一刻遇到了所有这些意外的技术问题。

segments.en: And I couldn't get into the database and extract the kind of information that I needed for the data analysis.
segments.cn: 我无法进入数据库提取我需要的数据分析信息。

segments.en: You know, if the tech guys would have done their job and kept the CRM stable, then I wouldn't have missed my deadline.
segments.cn: 你知道，如果技术人员能做好他们的工作，保持CRM的稳定，我就不会错过截止日期。

segments.en: Oh, come on.
segments.cn: 哦，得了吧。

segments.en: An excuse like that is tantamount to lying.
segments.cn: 这样的借口等同于撒谎。

segments.en: You're essentially blaming the tech team for your time management issues, rather than accepting responsibility for the fact that you were procrastinating for the past two weeks.
segments.cn: 你实际上是在把时间管理问题归咎于技术团队，而不是接受你在过去两周拖延的事实。

segments.en: No, I'm not trying to pass the buck here.
segments.cn: 不，我不是想推卸责任。

segments.en: I know it was me who was ultimately responsible for getting this done.
segments.cn: 我知道最终负责完成这项工作的是我。

segments.en: But the thing is, I could have finished on time if the system hadn't gone down.
segments.cn: 但问题是，如果系统没有崩溃，我本可以按时完成。

segments.en: And you know, with everything I've got going on now, I can't afford to waste time dealing with technical problems.
segments.cn: 你知道，考虑到我现在的所有事情，我不能浪费时间处理技术问题。

segments.en: I've got a lot of my plate, and there are only 24 hours in a day.
segments.cn: 我有很多事情要做，一天只有24小时。

segments.en: I'm not going to accept this excuse.
segments.cn: 我不会接受这个借口。

segments.en: You're using these small technical glitches as a crutch and trying to rationalize the fact that you've missed your deadline.
segments.cn: 你把这些小的技术故障当作支柱，试图合理化你错过截止日期的事实。

segments.en: Look, we have standards, and I expect you to live up to those standards.
segments.cn: 听着，我们有标准，我希望你能达到这些标准。

segments.en: No more phony excuses.
segments.cn: 不要再有虚假的借口。

segments.en: If you're in over your head, you tell me.
segments.cn: 如果你力不从心，你告诉我。

segments.en: No more missed deadlines.
segments.cn: 不要再错过截止日期。

segments.en: Now, I want that data on my desk by 9 A.M.
segments.cn: 现在，我希望早上9点之前把数据放在我的桌子上。

segments.en: This employee got in a lot of trouble for missing his deadline.
segments.cn: 这名员工因为错过截止日期而陷入了很多麻烦。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正是如此。

segments.en: I think it's a very important aspect of not only Western culture, but also, in general, assuming guilt when it's your fault.
segments.cn: 我认为这不仅是西方文化中非常重要的一个方面，而且在一般情况下，承认责任也是如此。

segments.en: Yeah.
segments.cn: 是的。

segments.en: In this case, we saw that the employee didn't really want to accept the fact that it was his fault.
segments.cn: 在这种情况下，我们看到员工并不真正想接受这是他的错。

segments.en: Yeah, he didn't say, Yeah, I know it was me.
segments.cn: 是的，他没有说，"是的，我知道是我。"

segments.en: I'm sorry.
segments.cn: "对不起。"

segments.en: And this is my plan to fix it.
segments.cn: "这是我解决问题的计划。"

segments.en: Now, this is very important among cultures, because in some cultures, the aspect of losing face is so important, right?
segments.cn: 现在，这在不同文化中非常重要，因为在某些文化中，失去面子是非常重要的，对吧？

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: So somebody may not really want to assume guilt, or they have to because it's part of the culture.
segments.cn: 所以，有些人可能不想承担责任，或者他们必须这样做，因为这是文化的一部分。

segments.en: But what's the standard in North American business practice?
segments.cn: 但北美商业实践的标准是什么？

segments.en: I would say that you would have to assume responsibility and take responsibility for your actions, right?
segments.cn: 我会说，你必须承担责任，为你的行为负责，对吧？

segments.en: And say, Yes, it's my fault I did it, but I'm gonna get it fixed, or I'll do it or I'll make up for it.
segments.cn: 并说，"是的，这是我的错，我做了，但我会解决它，或者我会做，或者我会弥补。"

segments.en: So some good business tips here today in this lesson.
segments.cn: 所以今天这节课里有一些好的商业建议。

segments.en: Now, remember, if you have any questions about the language, or want to tell us a little bit about how you assume responsibility in your culture, visit our website at EnglishPod.com.
segments.cn: 现在，记住，如果你对语言有任何问题，或者想告诉我们你在文化中如何承担责任，请访问我们的网站EnglishPod.com。

segments.en: Right, we're always there to help you out and until next time.
segments.cn: 对，我们一直在这里帮助你，直到下次。

segments.en: Thanks for listening and goodbye!
segments.cn: 感谢收听，再见！
